intro: Spermacoce costata, commonly known as the narrowleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branched stems and opposite leaves. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release tiny seeds when mature. Spermacoce costata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats.
